intro: Jaumea chevalieri, commonly known as the Cape mountain zinnia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its showy, daisy-like flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun. It is known for its vibrant yellow to orange petals and is often used in ornamental gardening. Jaumea chevalieri is relatively drought-tolerant, making it suitable for xeriscaping in arid regions.
